intro: Pilosella subcurvescens, commonly known as the bentleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, hairy leaves that are often curved, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella subcurvescens is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
